commit.message:
4811995: constraining BorderLayout math to prevent negative values

The BorderLayout worked great if it had enough space, but if the container was too small: it could assign negative widths/heights, or negative (x,y) values.

Also it always gave components their preferred width/height, even if that width/height ended up dangling outside of the parent container. For ex, if a parent was 100x100px, the child could still claim its size was 200x200px. Now children are constrained to fit inside the parent. Also children now should never overlap.
